Get 20% off your first Bespoke Post box at https://bespokepost.com/filmento by using code FILMENTO at checkout. Thanks to Bespoke Post for sponsoring the video.

Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore is another not-Harry Potter movie from Warner Brothers that is much like its predecessor The Crimes of Grindelwald: amazing to look at but boring to watch because of bad writing. And as before, most of the narrative faults come from JK Rowling doing the writing despite not being a screenwriter. She has had success with books but she keeps doing book things that do not work on screen. We talked about this in the last video "Crimes of Grindewald — Death by Author" but let's do it more. Here are a few more dangers to avoid when writing a film as a book author.

Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore
Warner Bros. Pictures’ “Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore” is the newest adventure in the Wizarding World created by J.K. Rowling. Professor Albus Dumbledore (Jude Law) knows the powerful Dark wizard Gellert Grindelwald (Mads Mikkelsen) is moving to seize control of the wizarding world.
